content: Let's start with something basic. Sorry I've put this off, but @Eric Huss I think you said you can't merge PRs?
I guess that membership is still accurate? (cc @isHavvy @Matthew Jasper)
I will sync it with a github team and give that team ownership over the ref I think

Yes. To be clear, the lead/member distinction is a bit fuzzy (with some context in https://github.com/rust-lang/team/pull/307), as there wasn't much discussion at the time (nobody asked me to be lead).

The permission issue is that I can't merge my own PRs (I can merge other PRs). And that's a bigger question of whether or not I should. If my PRs can get merged by other people within a reasonable amount of time, it doesn't matter. But if it takes weeks or months for small changes, that's frustrating and demotivating. Sometimes, I feel like it would make sense for me to just merge trivial changes like https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/pull/811. I have other PRs open, which I think are correct, but should I be allowed to just merge them?

It won't help to sync the team with GitHub. I already have write access. The issue is that the repo is configured with branch protections, and "require reviewer", and GitHub won't allow you to approve your own PR. Someone with admin access would need to remove those restrictions, or we should switch to bors. I would kinda prefer bors, but I don't feel strongly about it.
I think there's something to be said for "can't merge your own PR".
We should absolutely solve the timeliness problem.
Well, regardless we should fix the github team, but I understand better now
(i.e., we're trying to move away from individuals vs teams having access to repos in general)

If you asked a month ago, I'd say no, but if I ever get the energy to write anything, I'll definitely be writing for the reference again going forwards.

And if you have a trivial PR waiting on a reviewer, feel free to tag me on the PR.

isHavvy said:

And if you have a trivial PR waiting on a reviewer, feel free to tag me on the PR.

same here. I dont think I actually have any powers in that repo though, but I can at least give you feedback.

@isHavvy A couple more small PRs waiting for review: https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/pull/815 https://github.com/rust-lang/reference/pull/824 Let me know if you have any questions or if I can clarify anything.
They look good. They somehow slipped past my notice. I don't remember even getting an email for them.
